intro: Urostigma ilicinum, commonly known as the rock spurge, is a perennial flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and yellowish-green flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are often clustered in umbels, and its seed capsules contain numerous tiny seeds. Urostigma ilicinum is often used in rock gardens and as an ornamental plant due to its hardiness and aesthetic appeal.
